Summary: Firefox stops HTTP Digest Authentication after authentication realm has changed and another login is attempted using URL to provide credentials  http user pass host
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Windows NT 6 3 WOW64 AppleWebKit 537 36  KHTML like Gecko Chrome 34 0 1847 132 Safari 537 36 OPR 21 0 1432 57  Edition Campaign 51 Steps to reproduce I have been applying HTTP Digest Authentication  RFC 2617 with Firefox successfully for many years now To simulate a  logout functionality I use the authentication realm Once a logout occurs the current realm becomes invalid and with the next HTTP request a new realm is sent in the 401 HTTP header When using manual entry of username and password all works as expected But recently I tried providing the credentials with the URL  http user pass host Actual results When Firefox has just started up it works as expected request the URL http user pass host HTTP request GET  without authentication HTTP response 401 Unauthorized  including realm  realm1 HTTP request GET  using DIGEST authentication with  realm1 HTTP response 200 OK This is different when Firefox has already successfully authenticated once and has been running for a while Now the  logout occurs either active or by waiting for a timeout This means the former realm  realm1 is not valid anymore After requesting the URL  http user pass host with correct credentials Firefox shows the input dialog for user name and password instead of using the new realm  realm2 to authenticate successfully request the URL http user pass host HTTP request GET  without authentication HTTP response 401 Unauthorized  including realm  realm1 HTTP request GET  using DIGEST authentication with  realm1 HTTP response 200 OK  after a while realm1 becomes invalid now request the URL again http user pass host HTTP request GET  using DIGEST authentication with  realm1 HTTP response 401 Unauthorized  including realm  realm2 Firefox shows credentials dialog instead of using realm2 Expected results What I would have expected and what Opera  v21 is actually doing well is Firefox to try and authenticate using realm2 request the URL http user pass host HTTP request GET  without authentication HTTP response 401 Unauthorized  including realm  realm1 HTTP request GET  using DIGEST authentication with  realm1 HTTP response 200 OK  after a while realm1 becomes invalid now request the URL again http user pass host HTTP request GET  using DIGEST authentication with  realm1 HTTP response 401 Unauthorized  including realm  realm2 HTTP request GET  using DIGEST authentication with  realm2 HTTP response 200 OK This prevents me from seamlessly integrating several web interfaces the user has to re enter the credentials at every login although they have been provided correctly A fix would be very much appreciated

Summary: Trailing dot in SNI HostName must be stripped according to RFC 3546
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  X11 Linux i686 on x86_64 rv 24 0 Gecko 20140509 Firefox 24 0 Iceweasel 24 5 0  Nightly Aurora Build ID 20140509105114 Steps to reproduce Do a HTTPS request providing a URL containing a trailing dot  for the DNS root zone level e g https www google com Actual results HostName in SNI send to the server is  www google com Also the Apache webserver is rather unhappy and reports the SNI and HTTP HostName are not matching which in fact they are  exactly but nonetheless according to the RFC a trailing dot must not occur in a SNI host name When Firefox is patched  see attachment Apache is happy too Expected results HostName in SNI should be  www google com Section 3 1 of RFC 3546  0 states HostName contains the fully qualified DNS hostname of the server as understood by the client The hostname is represented as a byte  string using UTF 8 encoding  UTF8 without a trailing dot See also https github com bagder curl commit 5de8d84098db1bd24e7fffefbe14e81f2a05995a http curl haxx se mail lib 2014 04 0161 html The patch is just to merely a show case where a fix could be made and being an adaption from the cURL patch If the  host argument shall not be modified a duplication and inplace modification of the host name string might be fine but should be free d afterwards However maybe you want to fix normalize strip the host name string at an earlier point in time FYI patch is against 24 5 0esr however should be applicable on trunk too

Summary: font face Font files  sometimes improperly loaded
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  X11 Ubuntu Linux x86_64 rv 29 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 29 0  Beta Release Build ID 20140428193813 Steps to reproduce I have several font files each located in its own subfolder  polices family In my css file I load them this way  font face  font family Mate src url http www website com subfolder polices mate mate regular eot src url http www website com subfolder polices mate mate regular eot iefix format embedded opentype src url http www website com subfolder polices mate mate regular woff format woff src url http www website com subfolder polices mate mate regular ttf format truetype font weight normal font style normal Actual results On every other browsers I tested  qupzilla chromium iexplore the fonts are loaded and displayed correctly On Firefox the fonts are sometimes  emphasis on  sometimes loaded correctly But most of the times they aren t In that case the web developer toolbar indicates that the source file is loaded correctly  Status 200 OK but its size is 0 Ko The files are located on the same domain  it is not a case of cross domain or sub domain Just to be sure I changed the value of security fileuri strict_origin_policy to false but to no avail If I put the source file s url in the adress bar I can always download it Expected results Well the font files should be downloaded If they fail to download there should be an error message in the console

Summary: TLS handshake fails on CORS requests because no certificate is sent
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Windows NT 6 1 WOW64 AppleWebKit 537 36  KHTML like Gecko Chrome 34 0 1847 132 Safari 537 36 OPR 21 0 1432 67 Steps to reproduce Doing 2 way SSL auth on a CORS request Actual results The client certificate is not being sent to the server before doing the initial preflight request As a result the TLS handshake fails and the OPTIONS request is aborted hence the CORS request can t be performed Using the same environment but running the Javascript request in the same origin  withouth the need of CORS works as expected In addition if I keep using CORS but I disable SSL client auth at the server everything work as well Expected results The SSL client certificate should be sent in the TLS handshake so the preflight OPTIONS request could be correctly sent

Summary: Select element with title attribute drop down list always shows that title value
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Windows NT 6 1 WOW64 rv 29 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 29 0  Beta Release Build ID 20140506152807 Steps to reproduce Run below source code see section 1 move the pointer over anyone options such as b which will auto shows select title value In order to fix it I add  title to all options see section 2 Section 1 select style width 190px title The value of select title attribute option value 1 a option option value 2 b option option value 3 c option option value 4 d option select Section 2 select style width 190px title The value of select title attribute option value 1 title a option option value 2 title b option option value 3 title c option option value 4 title d option select Actual results Run that source code move the pointer over anyone options such as b which will auto shows select title value Expected results Run that source code move the pointer over anyone options such as b which will don t show any tip text without title attribute

Summary: Developer tools sends extra requests for CSS with no cache headers
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  X11 Ubuntu Linux x86_64 rv 30 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 30 0  Beta Release Build ID 20140608211457 Steps to reproduce Doesn t seem to happen on every site but happens on some sites As an example of a site that exhibits the behaviour look at Newegg com Open the developer tools request tab and visit the site Further information will be in the  What happened section Actual results You will notice that newegg v1 w 10393 1 css  or whatever the first CSS file is named is the first file requested in the requests tab of developer tools Then scroll down to near the bottom and you will see that at some point  likely after page load ready newegg v1 w 10393 1 css  the same css file as the first file is requested an additional five times this time with no cache headers each time Other websites I ve encountered exhbiting this issue don t always request the CSS over with no cache headers the same number of times Generally the number of extra requests if they happen ranges from 3 to 6 On my own server I ve examined server logs with and without developer tools open and I can confirm that the extra requests are only sent with developer tools open When they re closed it sends one request as expected Likewise the problem occurs even with extensions disabled Also not replicable in Chrome Expected results The first CSS file should be requested only once

Summary: Fonts loaded from cache are missing from DevTools network tab
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Macintosh Intel Mac OS X 10 9 rv 32 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 32 0  Beta Release Build ID 20140616004003 Steps to reproduce 1 Navigate to a site using custom fonts and returns 304 for unmodified resources 2 Open the DevTools 3 Activate the network tab 4 Reload the page Actual results Initial font requests will show up in the list with a 200 status response but subsequent loads will not show any font request response Expected results Font loads from the cache should be shown in the list with a 304 status response

Summary: Setting a cookie in body of document isn t available for reading in loaded js
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Windows NT 6 1 WOW64 rv 31 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 31 0  Beta Release Build ID 20140610163407 Steps to reproduce Create a cookie in body of html e g function setCookie c_name value exdays var exdate new Date exdate setDate exdate getDate exdays var c_value escape value exdays null expires exdate toUTCString document cookie c_name  c_value enable local debugging setCookie localOn 1 1 Load a new js script e g document write unescape 3Cscript src ams js tag_os js type text javascript 3E 3C script 3E Try to read the cookie from within the loaded js script e g function readCookie name var nameEQ  name  var ca  document cookie split for var i 0 i  ca length i var c  ca i while c charAt 0 c  c substring 1 c length if c indexOf nameEQ 0 return c substring nameEQ length c length return null readCookie localOn Actual results The cookie was not found Notes  when stepping through with debugger problem vanished Expected results The cookie should have been found with the value of 1

Summary: Using socks proxy though SSH tunnel causes tunnel to disconnect with  Received data for nonexistent channel
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Macintosh Intel Mac OS X 10 9 rv 30 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 30 0  Beta Release Build ID 20140605174243 Steps to reproduce Reproducible with Putty SecureCRT under Windows7 and SSH on OSX 10 9 2 1 Build a SSH tunnel  ssh  D 8080 user host  vvvv Verbose output not needed to reproduce but gives additional data 2 Configure Firefox to use socks proxy reproducible with socks 4  5 with or without DNS forwarding 3 Load a site with high amount of threads www whatismyip com will reproduce almost every time Actual results 1 Page loads in part 2 SSH session disconnected with error  Disconnecting Received data for nonexistent channel followed by a channel number 3 From SSH logs it looks like Firefox is referencing a thread that it already closed Expected results SSH session should stay available and page should load

Summary: Firefox not properly responding to the closure of the server connection per RFC  408 response
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Macintosh Intel Mac OS X 10 9 rv 30 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 30 0  Beta Release Build ID 20140605174243 Steps to reproduce Visit http www godmode trader de Open the network analysis tool in firefox to see when 408 responses show up  Press F5 until the upper part of the advertisment is not visible anymore  the area is marked red on attached Screenshot_1 and the network analysis shows a 408 response  marked green It can take up to 20 reloads until the error occurs Actual results Firefox does not properly respond to the closure of the server connection per RFC if the closure also contains an HTTP response and does not properly handle re sending the request through a working connection instead incorrectly assuming that the error response is the response to a newly sent request Attached is a tcpdump in which the behaviour described has been recored Expected results Realize that the connection has been closed by the server and don t give the user the 408 error as the apparent result of their request Chrome had exactly the same bug  http code google com p chromium issues detail id 377581  which has been resolved in the mean time

Summary: No prompt username and password dialog box proxy startup
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  X11 Linux x86_64 rv 28 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 28 0  Beta Release Build ID 20140314220517 Steps to reproduce I tried to access the internet Always when I m trying to access the internet at first time when I turn on my machine no username e password prompt appear for me I only got access to the internet when I use the Google Chrome typing my username and password Actual results No proxy authenticaton dialog box No prompt username and password I received the follow message Access denied due to authentication failure Expected results Should appear the proxy authenticate dialog box requiring my username and password

Summary: ScratchPad in Aurora on a Mac won t open HTM files
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Windows NT 6 1 WOW64 rv 32 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 32 0  Beta Release Build ID 20140716004001 Steps to reproduce On a Mac only this works fine on Windows 7 and Windows 8 In Aurora Scratchpad create an HTML file  A HTML with a  script src A js and save it in a local directory Close Scratchpad Reopen Scratchpad and do an Open File aimed at the local directory where the two files were saved Actual results Both A js and A html are visibile but A html is grayed out and can t be selected to open A js can be opened without problem We tried renaming A html to A txt opening it in Scratchpad which worked then resaveing it as A html but after the rename it still can t be selected to open Expected results All the html files should be selectable to be opened in Scratchpad This works without problems on Windows machines

Summary: Can t watch youtube video without a connected sound output device

Summary: Cannot enable D3D11 in Firefox 31 0 on Windows 7
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Windows NT 6 1 WOW64 rv 31 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 31 0  Beta Release Build ID 20140716183446 Steps to reproduce My WebGL application requires native OpenGL or ANGLE  with D3D11 backend It doesn t work with ANGLE  D3D9 Steps to reproduce 1 Set webgl prefer native gl to false 2 Set OMTC to true Actual results ANGLE  D3D9 as the WebGL Renderer Expected results ANGLE  D3D11 as the WebGL Renderer or some flag where I can enable using D3D11 as the ANGLE backend instead of D3D9

Summary: HTML video element consumes memory too aggressively and may cause OOM or freeze system
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Windows NT 6 1 WOW64 rv 31 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 31 0  Beta Release Build ID 20140716183446 Steps to reproduce Create tens of detached  not presented in main html tree or normal video elements set preload auto or preload metadata and set src to a HD video file  720p or above Watch the memory usage of firefox in task manager For convinience you can use the attached htm file to accomplish steps above Download the file to your disk load it with FF input the url to a local HD video file and click  create 10 detached videos or  insert 10 videos several times If interested you can also test embed elements instead of video elements Actual results On my windows 7 64bit machine for HD mp4 video firefox comsumes 30 80 MB for each video element with preload auto and a bit less for preload metadata Webm consumes a bit less memory than mp4 Therefore tens of detached video elements can exhauts the virtual memory of 32bit firefox After that newly created video elements begin reporting  decode error in the console and firefox may even crash On my machine 1080p mp4 can crash 32bit firefox for sure but 720p can t If the system hasn t enough physical memory it may be also freezed Expected results Video elements in firefox should not consume too much memory especially for detached ones Ideally browsers may discard most memories related to  video when it not playing and is invisible  either out of viewport or has display none or is detached from main DOM tree only retain several states  readyState currentTime etc Thus browsers should be able to handle hundreds of  video s in a page with a small memory footprint

Summary: Mime type incorrect for PDF uploads with PHP on Firefox version 31
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Windows NT 6 1 WOW64 rv 31 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 31 0  Beta Release Build ID 20140716183446 Steps to reproduce Upload pdf document using standard webform using Firefox version 31 Repeated with version 30 and worked correctly Actual results php detects mime type as application x forcedownload Expected results php should detect mime type as application pdf

Summary: Firefox randomly using IPv6 via 6to4 relay on IPv4 connected client  servers
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Windows NT 6 3 WOW64 rv 34 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 34 0  Beta Release Build ID 20140820030202 Steps to reproduce Browse a dual stack connected website any Google Facebook property will do with a client that has a native IPv4 connectivity only and 6to4 enabled  default in Windows might need an ISP that runs a relay though Observe in TCPView Actual results Firefox issues IPv4 and or v6 connections for the different hosts involved seemingly at random Expected results Firefox should prefer the faster native v4 connection and only fall back to 6to4 for hosts that are reachable exclusively via v6 I haven t seen this before today s nightly and it s the first time I show up as logged in from a  2002 prefixed v6 address on GMail I d suspect something to do with https bugzilla mozilla org show_bug cgi id 820391

Summary: in developer toolbar in network tab timeline shows upto 8 minutes of transaction
Description: In developer toolbar in network tab after starting performance analysis and reloading page for first 8 19 minutes  time taken to access resources such as html page css file images etc and all post requests along with details of Method File Domain Size Type However after 8 19 minutes of activity other details except time taken are displayed One has to click on each record and there you see a split of DNS Lookup Sending Connecting and Receiving time Horizontal scrollbar should be instead displayed and user should be able view time taken for records Also the other details such as Method File Domain Size Type should remain static like freezed panes in spreadsheets and only timeline part scrollable

Description: Hi I m trying to set this and other firefox preferences for a lot of computers at the same time I have there made a  js file with several settings located in the the firefox lib dir It works as expected all required preferences are set except the network negotiate auth trusted uris  Firefox ignores the pref I have put these two lines  the second just to check it into the preferences file pref network negotiate auth trusted uris https test de pref network negotiate auth trusted urix https test de It works for the  urix but not for the  uris It still shows just https in the about config So there must be something special about this variable for firefox not to accept it

Summary: Seeking does not work in videos recorded with MediaStreamRecorder
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Macintosh Intel Mac OS X 10 9 rv 35 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 35 0 Build ID 20140910030204 Steps to reproduce 1 Record a video using MediaStreamRecorder as in this example https www webrtc experiment com msr audio recorder html 2 Save the resulting video as a Blob 3 Play the video in the browser and again in VLC Actual results When the video plays back in Firefox and in VLC it is impossible to seek within the video Seeking does work in Chrome When loading the video in Firefox after the  durationchange and  loadedmetadata methods the duration is reported as 0 In Chrome the duration is reported as Infinity An audio file recorded without video works fine Expected results The video file should be saved with a duration and seeking should function properly

Summary: Use VideoProcessBlt for Color Conversion for video playback
Description: Video playback is taking approximately 7 3D calls per decoded frame resulting in high GPU utilization For fullscreen playback in desktop mode there should be at most two 3D rendering calls per frame one for Color Conversion from NV12 to RGB and one for PresentBLT Using VideoProcessingBlt call for color conversion it would be reduced to 1 If Overlay Present call is made then there should be 0 3D call per frame

Summary: Firefox caches HTML5 video source URL temporal redirects
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Windows NT 6 1 WOW64 rv 33 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 33 0 Build ID 20141106120505 Steps to reproduce The HTML 5 video tag contains source sub element That element points to some URL  base URL The service at this URL executes some logic and sends 302 redirect to the browser Actual results Firefox follows the redirect and sends request to the second URL The second URL streams the video and it is available for Range requests For the next HTTP Range requests  if any Firefox uses the second URL directly i e the browser uses the base URL only once per video at the very beginning All following Range requests are sent directly to the second URL Is this proper behavior according to the HTTP specification Injecting  Cache Control no cache no store response headers does not make any difference Expected results Each HTTP Range request shall use the base URL specified in the HTML 5 video source element

Summary: CORS GET request with no special headers fails to follow redirect
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  X11 Ubuntu Linux i686 rv 35 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 35 0 Build ID 20141110194624 Steps to reproduce 1 Go to http fiatjaf alhur es scrapbook 2 Wait for the page to load Actual results Firefox sends a preflight  OPTIONS request to https fiatjaf couchappy com scrapbook _design scrapbook _rewrite then the actual request and gets back a 302 redirect which it does not follow and fails with an unrelated error Cross Origin Request Blocked The Same Origin Policy disallows reading the remote resource at https fiatjaf couchappy com scrapbook _design scrapbook _rewrite This can be fixed by moving the resource to the same domain or enabling CORS The page shows a blank form and nothing below it Expected results The browser shouldn t have sent the preflight request as the main request was a simple GET with no special headers then it should had followed the redirect The page should show a list of comments below the blank form

Summary: Sock5 proxy connection fail
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Windows NT 6 1 WOW64 rv 34 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 34 0 Build ID 20141126041045 Steps to reproduce I use a sock5 proxy running on port 53 with no authentication It was working fine till a few months ago 1 At first I was using FoxyProxy My connections started to fail So I thought the problem was with foxyproxy addon I completely uninstalled and cleaned every Mozilla directory from my system 2 Reinstalled Mozilla from scratch This time no addon is installed 3 In Network settings Porxy is defined as manual proxy xxx xxxx co uk 53 with remote dns Ne connection is available 4 In Network settings I define the proxy as use system defined proxy Still no connection is available 5 If I use the same settings with Internet Explorer which uses System Settings everything works fine 6 This bug is only for Windows I switched to Lubuntu 14 10 Firefox with foxyproxy works fine with the same computer Actual results Firefox addon Foxyproxy fails to work with SOCK5 proxy After a clean Firefox installation without Foxyproxy Firefox definition of SOCK5 proxy fails to work in windows Firefox definition of system proxy settings fail to work in windows All these problems are gone in Linux Expected results Sock5 proxy with no authentication and remote dns settings should work as it is working in Linux version

Summary: proxy authentication Firefox should give up trying to re auth if another auth mechanism already chosen
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  X11 Ubuntu Linux x86_64 rv 34 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 34 0 Build ID 20141127111021 Steps to reproduce Windows 7 joined to Active Directory  User is signed in with local Windows account not a domain one  Firefox 31 3 0esr is configured to use proxy which supports both basic and negotiation authentication 1 I start Firefox 2 Proxy asks for login password 3 User provide working credentials for proxy and start browsing Actual results Proxy access log are filled with deny access to http some web site  allow access to http some web site  deny access to http another web site  allow access to http another web site Proxy system log are filled with WARNING try negotiation and failed  auth with basic  WARNING try negotiation and failed  auth with basic and so on Expected results Proxy access log should have with deny access to http some web site  allow access to http some web site  allow access to http another web site Proxy system log are filled with WARNING try negotiation and failed  auth with basic  auth with basic  auth with basic  auth with basic and so on I e Firefox tries to use negotiation protocol and failed So it falls back to basic authentication and Firefox tries to use negotiation again on every new connection Firefox should not try to re auth with negotiation  as it is already failed and fall back scheme found to be working and should use only basic auth untill browser restarts or proxy settings are changed

Summary: Session is recovered only on the second restart related to timestamped upgrade backups in sessionstore backups

Summary: Firefox ESR is slow when using a proxy pac file in an entreprise environment with proxy infrastructure
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  compatible MSIE 9 0 Windows NT 6 1 WOW64 Trident 5 0 SLCC2 NET CLR 2 0 50727 NET CLR 3 5 30729 NET CLR 3 0 30729 Media Center PC 6 0 NET4 0C NET4 0E Steps to reproduce Using Firefox 17 0 11esr and all later versions in an enterpise environment with a proxy pac file  Automatic proxy configuration URL Is still the cas in the latest versions of Firefox Actual results Using a PAC file Firefox does a DNS request and  depending on your OS and configuration  a NetBIOS request for each object it loads This can lead to a huge slowdown of the overall operation especially when your configured DNS servers are not able to resolve internet names  as it is often the case in organizations where you connect to the internet through a proxy Expected results The only DNS requests the browser should be performing are to resolve the proxy ies address es that s all To my knowledge it should NEVER perform a DNS request for the OCS hostname of the objects it has to load as long as the PAC file doesn t provide a DIRECT directive for the specific host

Summary: Incorrect redraw when maximized and switching monitors with keyboard
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Windows NT 6 1 WOW64 rv 37 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 37 0 Build ID 20150415140819 Steps to reproduce Platform Win 7 Pro x64 w SP1 Dual monitor setup both same size side by side Firefox 37 0 2 Tried with a separate  clean profile  no add ons 1 Maximize Firefox on the monitor without the taskbar 2 With that Firefox window in focus move it to the other monitor using Win Shift Left Arrow or Win Shift Right Arrow Actual results Firefox redraws incorrectly It appears to be mostly ignoring the taskbar For my configuration with the taskbar on the right edge of the right screen as shown in attached screenshot 1 The window management buttons  maximize minimize restore are roughly in the right places but minimize and restore are greyed out 2 The Navigation Bar web page contents and Bookmarks Toolbar  not shown extend past where the window should end to underneath the taskbar 3 Not shown If present the vertical scrollbar is also hidden beneath the taskbar Different redraw issues occur when the taskbar is located elsewhere Expected results Firefox should account for the taskbar when it redraws while maximized

Summary: Dynamically loaded image sometimes receives 206 never completes
Description: I m building a little animation like a visual novel So at the beginning I want to load all the images I do something like this  translated from coffeescript  jquery var img  document createElement img container appendChild img var promise  new Promise function resolve reject img addEventListener load resolve img addEventListener error resolve img src  return promise Elsewhere all these promises are aggregated together If any of them fails I show an error once they all succeed I let the viewer play the animation But once in a great while one or two of the images are requested with a Range header  I think it was always  bytes 65536 and get back a 206 And then nothing else happens There are no further requests and neither  load nor  error fire So the promise never resolves and the viewer sees  loading forever There s nothing in the error console not even the global one Once this has happened if I try viewing the bad image directly I still see a Range request sent and a 206 received but Firefox only shows a blank white tab Even ctrl f5 from such a state doesn t help  presumably because the image hasn t actually loaded so I can t  refresh it in the first place the only fix is to explicitly clear the last hour of my cache My wildest guess is that a partial image is getting stuck in the cache somehow hence my choice of component But beyond that I m kind of at a loss here Unfortunately I ve yet to figure out how to reproduce this reliably It happened on almost every page load yesterday and I foolishly chalked it up to my dev server misbehaving But when I finally deployed today and linked the result to an IRC channel four people immediately reported seeing an infinite  loading screen that was fixed by clearing their caches All four of them were using Firefox Here it is live perhaps you ll get  un lucky and encounter the same problem warning sound http apps veekun com flora cutscenes prompt2 itchyitchy part2

Summary: Choosing to clear the cache on exit shouldn t disable it altogether
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Windows NT 6 1 Win64 x64 Trident 7 0 NET CLR 2 0 50727 SLCC2 NET CLR 3 5 30729 NET CLR 3 0 30729 Media Center PC 6 0 NET4 0C NET4 0E InfoPath 3 rv 11 0 like Gecko Steps to reproduce Default value for  privacy clearOnShutdown cache is true Change  privacy sanitize sanitizeOnShutdown from default  false to true Setting both of these preferences to true disables caching Actual results I would like to revisit Bug 709262  https bugzilla mozilla org show_bug cgi id 709262 I see the issue is the cache is disabled when the preferences  privacy clearOnShutdown cache and  privacy sanitize sanitizeOnShutdown are both set to true Reading all of the comments the logic in the  fix is very flawed Why would you disable the cache just to satisfy the need to exit the browser quickly I know the thread started with a much earlier version of Firefox but it apparently still affects current versions  31 5 3 If I go into Options Privacy and select to use custom settings for the history and then check the  Clear history box I can then set what I want to clear What preferences do each of those checkboxes map to There has to be a better way to implement clearing private data You aren t even clearing it you re not allowing it to be cached at all Expected results The cache should be enabled and just the relevant data should be flushed from the cache when exiting the browser

Summary: Websocket Flow Control Tell server to stop sending when client cannot handle it
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Windows NT 6 3 WOW64 rv 37 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 37 0 Build ID 20150415140819 Steps to reproduce We have a program which runs JavaScript and opens a Websocket connection continuously receiving data from a server for a RDP connection our program runs Actual results By the time the handling speed of the incoming data is lower than the receiving speed the data is getting queued indefinitely The memory consumed is grows because the server side keeps sending data though on the other end it is not being handled In the end the Firefox process grows to several GBs and crashes Expected results Websocket should like TCP when the client cannot  or does not handle the data  give a feedback to the server for it to stop sending In our tests this happens and is thus correctly implemented only in Internet Explorer Could the Websocket protocol implementation be worked over I looked for some other bug describing this behaviour but since i didn t find one I submit hereby a new one

Summary: System Proxy Settings  stored authentication details not used on a Mac
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Macintosh Intel Mac OS X 10_10_3 AppleWebKit 537 36  KHTML like Gecko Chrome 42 0 2311 152 Safari 537 36 Steps to reproduce I have a Squid3 Proxy Server running under Ubuntu Linux 12 0 4 Squid is set to require clients to authenticate and the authentication details are checked via LDAP to a directory server The availability of the proxy server is defined using a proxy pac aka wpad dat file and this is advertised via WPAD  Web Proxy Auto Discovery using both DHCP and DNS methods We are using a mixture of Mac OS X 10 9 5 10 10 3 and Windows 7 clients This works in Safari on the Mac and IE on Windows 7 On a Mac it is set to use  Automatic Proxy Discovery which is Apple s term for using WPAD When Safari is launched for the first time it asks for authentication details which Squid checks via LDAP the Mac saves these credentials in the users login keychain Safari will then ask for permission to access the keychain and these credentials if allowed Safari will then be able to do this automatically thereafter without further user interaction It is possible to modify the access permissions for these credentials in the keychain so that all applications can automatically access them and I have done this This works for example for using the Mac App Store and iTunes Firefox on the Mac is set to use the system proxy settings i e the default option It does correctly find the WPAD learned proxy server and does correctly send web traffic via the proxy server It however incorrectly asks the user for authentication details even those as stated these are already stored in the users login keychain and have been made available to all applications Worse still even if the user fills in authentication details  again Firefox does not preserve these between sessions When Firefox is next relaunched it will ask for authentication credentials to use the proxy server again This happens regardless of whether the option to  Do not prompt for authentication if password is saved is ticked or not Actual results Firefox successfully learns the System Proxy settings and sends the request to the proxy server but then  incorrectly displays an authentication dialog for using the proxy server If this is filled in it works  but only for that session Next time Firefox is launched it asks for authentication details again Expected results Firefox did successfully learn the System Proxy settings to find and send traffic via the proxy server but failed to use the stored authentication details

Summary: WebCrypto callbacks occur during synchronous XHR
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  X11 Fedora Linux x86_64 rv 38 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 38 0 Build ID 20150511091651 Steps to reproduce With synchronous XHR requests the main JS thread is blocked and other callbacks do not occur while execution is blocking inside the  send method Unfortunately WebCrypto promises are resolved during blocking XHR requests rather than deferred to the next run of the event loop after the XHR completes To reproduce run the following in a console window testRequest  function var req  new XMLHttpRequest req open GET http start fedoraproject org false req onload  function console log request loaded return req  crypto subtle generateKey name AES GCM length 128 false encrypt then function rv window aesKey  rv window testEnc  function crypto subtle encrypt name AES GCM iv new Uint8Array 16 tagLength 128 window aesKey new Uint8Array 1 2 3 then function rv console log got encryption result rv Key line kick off WebCrypto and XHR WebCrypto callback occurs  inside send window testEnc window testRequest send console log send done For comparison timers  are deferred during XHR send setTimeout function console log timer fired 0 window testRequest send console log send done Actual results We see the following in the console got encryption result object ArrayBuffer request loaded send done request loaded send done timer fired Expected results Should have seen the following in the console as occurs in Chrome request loaded send done got encryption result object ArrayBuffer request loaded send done timer fired

Summary: Firefox extensions can t set proxy for RTMPT requests made by Flash
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  X11 Ubuntu Linux x86_64 rv 38 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 38 0 Build ID 20150511103818 Steps to reproduce 1 Install the attached add on The only thing it will do is register a proxy filter and print all requests that can be proxied in the applyFilter method 2 Configure Firefox to use a proxy that is located in the UK 3 Open the following site from outside the UK http www bbc co uk iplayer episode b05y0v73 the john bishop show episode 1 4 Start capturing your network traffic with Wireshark  https www wireshark org 5 Start the video on the site and wait for an error message 6 Stop the Wireshark live capture 7 In Wireshark display only captured RTMP RTMPT traffic  enter  rtmpt into Filter text field and cross reference with the output that the attached add on wrote to the Browser Console I m sorry this is so complicated to reproduce Unfortunately I don t know a lot about Flash Actual results 1 The Flash video player attempts to load the video via RTMP This request is not proxied so it is rejected as only UK IP addresses are accepted  you can see this by inspecting the packets in Wireshark 2 The Flash video player falls back to RTMPT  RTMP over HTTP which could theoretically be proxied The request is not proxied and fails for the same reason as the previous one The RTMPT request was not proxied even though Firefox was configured to proxy HTTP requests This can be confirmed by looking at the destination address in Wireshark which is not the address of the proxy In addition an extension could not have set a proxy either You can confirm this by comparing the RTMPT requests from Wireshark to the log messages from the attached add on Here s what the RTMPT requests look like  excerpt POST  send 2_Zmdz02ySLmi48Z 1 HTTP 1 1 r n  Host 194 25 95 158 r n Nothing like that is being logged by the add on Expected results That the original RTMP request failed is expected RTMP is based on TCP and should not be affected by HTTP proxy settings The RTMPT requests should have been affected by Firefox proxy settings The requests should have been proxied It should have been possible for an add on to set a proxy for the RTMPT requests That means the requests should have been passed to the applyFilter method and thus been logged by the add on I m expecting RTMTP requests to be proxied for two reasons 1 Comments from Adobe staff that this should be possible See here https forums adobe com message 4262734 2 In Google Chrome RTMTP requests are properly proxied For a more realistic scenario please compare the behaviour of the Firefox version of anonymoX  https addons mozilla org en US firefox addon anonymox with its Chrome version  https chrome google com webstore detail anonymox icpklikeghomkemdellmmkoifgfbakio The Firefox version won t display the video for the reasons outlined in this bug report The Chrome version will work as the RTMPT requests are being proxied

Summary: Very frequent kernel panics in com apple GeForce 6 3 6 module on OS X 10 6 8
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Macintosh Intel Mac OS X 10 6 rv 38 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 38 0 Build ID 20150624141534 Steps to reproduce Normal surfing The KPs just appear to happen randomly the sites I m visiting have nothing obvious in common with them Sometimes KPs even happen right when I open a new browser window  start page is set to blank page KPs happen every few hours or so I ve already disabled hardware graphics acceleration in Firefox settings My machine is a MacBookPro5 2  17 late 2009 GeForce 9400M and 9600M GT with OS X 10 6 8  10K549 Which of the two graphics chips is active seemingly does not matter the issue appears to happen with both Actual results Frequent kernel panics always in the same module  com apple GeForce 6 3 6 with 4 dependencies and always connected to the  firefox process Expected results no kernel panic maybe Yes I know that userland applications should not be able to produce a KP in the first place and given the circumstances it appears to be a bug in the graphics driver introduced by Apple Yet when such a bug is broadly known  and even has a track record this long as this bug here  others reported similar bugs in multiple previous versions of FF I would expect software devs to work around the issue and not stick to whatever calls that are causing those KPs Firefox is the only application I ve ever used that has managed to produce KPs I ve made an experiment I threw Firefox 39 off my machine and installed 38 1 0 ESR So far  about a day of usage already I haven t encountered a single kernel panic I guess this should help you close in on the piece of code in your software that does the relevant calls I ve also attached an archive with 12 kernel panic logs of the issue

Summary: ssl sslmutex c uses sem_init sem_destroy that are unsupported on iOS
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Macintosh Intel Mac OS X 10_10_4 AppleWebKit 537 36  KHTML like Gecko Chrome 44 0 2403 107 Safari 537 36 Steps to reproduce When building ssl sslmutex c targeting iOS with  Wdeprecated declarations the compiler reports that sem_init and sem_destroy are deprecated In fact those interface are not implemented on iOS they just return an error Actual results net third_party nss ssl sslmutex c 522 14 warning sem_init is deprecated  Wdeprecated declarations rv  sem_init pMutex u sem shared 1 Applications Xcode app Contents Developer Platforms iPhoneSimulator platform Developer SDKs iPhoneSimulator9 0 sdk usr include sys semaphore h 55 5 note sem_init has been explicitly marked deprecated here int sem_init sem_t  int unsigned int __deprecated net third_party nss ssl sslmutex c 544 7 warning sem_destroy is deprecated  Wdeprecated declarations rv  sem_destroy pMutex u sem Applications Xcode app Contents Developer Platforms iPhoneSimulator platform Developer SDKs iPhoneSimulator9 0 sdk usr include sys semaphore h 53 5 note sem_destroy has been explicitly marked deprecated here int sem_destroy sem_t  __deprecated Expected results No warning should be reported by the compiler Possible replacements are GCD semaphores or named semaphore  sem_open sem_close http stackoverflow com a 27847103 5353

Summary: getCookiesFromHost does not follow spec or documentation
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  X11 Linux i686 rv 38 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 38 0 Build ID 20150514102509 Steps to reproduce nsICookieManager2 has the methods getCookiesFromHost and countCookiesFromHost The MDN page  https developer mozilla org en US docs Mozilla Tech XPCOM Reference Interface nsICookieManager2 describes the matching process a specified in RFC 2965 but the code does not follow this The matching should be that the host string is an exact match for the cookie host or the cookie host is a suffix of the host string and the character before the suffix is a dot  ie foo foo bar matches a cookies with hosts foo foo bar and foo bar plus the  wildcard foo bar Instead the code in nsICookieManager2 matches the base domain of the host string parameter to be a suffix of the cookie host Hence it matches cookies which are not valid for the host string passed to the function For example passing www wikipedia org to GetCookiesFromHost will correctly return cookies for www wikipedia org wikipedia org and  wikipedia org but also incorrectly returns cookies for en wikipedia org and simple wikipedia org The new storage actor code for the developer toolbar  actors storage js recognises this and additionally filters the returned list However it filters out too much For example the page www wikipedia org shows cookies for www wikipedia org and  wikipedia org but cookies with host wikipedia org are not shown

Summary: Connection to websocket service takes longer and longer as more tabs are opened with the same connection if server is closed while these connections where opened
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Macintosh Intel Mac OS X 10 10 rv 39 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 39 0 Build ID 20150630154324 Steps to reproduce In order to reproduce this bug you need to follow these steps 1 Run a service such as the attached Node websockets test server on localhost 2 Open a web page that connects to this websockets service Make sure that the page connects to it In the provided example you need to click  connect 3 Do this with at least 5 more tabs but 10 12 is recommended to see clearer results 3 Now kill the server 4 The pages should now show  not connected 5 Run the server again 6 Click connect in ALL pages Can be reproduced at least on OSX and Windows Actual results Beyond the 4 5 pages threshold it takes more and more time to initiate this connection This builds up waiting time with each extra connection that you have established the more pages you have the more it takes to connect Additionally this blocking behavior affects all tabs but as soon as one connects all of them do Expected results Pages should try to connect instantly as soon as connection is requested On Chrome Safari and IE that is what happens

Summary: Setting gfx xrender enabled to false makes a profile unusable

Summary: Add a  Replace entry in  Edit menu of Scratchpad and include this action in the description of Ctrl Shift R keyboard shortcut in the documentation
Description: Open Scratchpad  Open Edit Menu  Notice that there is no  Replace entry Open Scratchpad documentation  https developer mozilla org en US docs Tools Scratchpad Keyboard_shortcuts by pressing Help Scratchpad Help You ll notice that Ctrl Shift R is only described as Reload the current page then run Scratchpad code There is no mention for this  Replace feature in the page at all Now switch to Scratchpad and press Ctrl Shift R the CodeMirror  Replace With prompt appears But note once the CodeMirror  Replace prompt has focus in scratchpad Ctrl Shift R will reload and run the scratchpad code So I d suggest that you add a  Replace entry in  Edit menu and include this action in the description of Ctrl Shift R keyboard shortcut in the documentation Related bug 995756

Summary: sqlite change heap js crashes SpiderMonkey when run with  ion loop unrolling on
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Windows NT 6 1 Win64 x64 AppleWebKit 537 36  KHTML like Gecko Chrome 44 0 2403 155 Safari 537 36 Steps to reproduce I checked out the latest gecko dev using the git mirror  currently on git commit 458762048bb5200d117ccd69e46f7c847e4eca99 Compiled SpiderMonkey providing no arguments to  configure or make Ran the attached script with  ion loop unrolling on on an X64 Ubuntu Then SpiderMonkey segfaulted I ve tried to see if i could narrow the bug down using some tool The problem is just that as soon as I parse the file using esprima and emit it again using escodegen the problem disappears Same thing with jsmin and Closure Compiler but not jsbeautifier So the problem might be that there is some weird syntax somewhere in the script that somehow crashes SpiderMonkey with  ion loop unrolling on The script is from the Google V8 test suite Actual results SpiderMonkey seqfaults Expected results It should exit producing no output

Summary: Streaming services flush the disk cache
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  X11 Linux i686 rv 38 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 38 0 Build ID 20150514102509 Steps to reproduce 1 Open a streaming service such as http www bbc co uk iplayer live bbcone 2 Play it for a while Actual results 1 Disk cache entries are steadily evicted and replaced with in this case video fragments Expected results 1 Preferably don t flush the entire disk cache Not sure what the exact solution might be The video fragments appear to be tagged correctly for caching but clearly the behaviour is destructive

Summary: Firefox does not always recognize IPv6 addresses
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  X11 Linux x86_64 rv 40 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 40 0 Build ID 20150812163655 Steps to reproduce Modify  etc hosts to contain an IPv6 address for a certain host then use an IPv4 only Internet connection and try to use the website Note that  etc hosts should NOT contain an IPv4 address for the same host Actual results Firefox does not try to find an IPv4 address for the host and in about networking  DNS it shows the IPv6 address but it s labeled as IPv4 address See attached screenshot When trying to load the website it gives an  unable to connect error Expected results Firefox should recognize that there is only an IPv6 address listed How to handle the case is a choice It could make a DNS query for the A record and if found use that Or it could choose NOT to do a query because  etc hosts is typically used for debugging If the person who edited  etc hosts only includes an IPv6 address they might explicitly not want to use IPv4 for that host If the second option is used  explicitly not doing a DNS query because the host was found in  etc hosts we might want to give a more detailed error message I would personally go for the first option because if the user wants to test with IPv6 only they can just edit the DNS to do so

Summary: Firefox shows part of screenshot when dragging text  see screencast
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  X11 Fedora Linux x86_64 rv 40 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 40 0 Build ID 20150812142102 Steps to reproduce Open an email in the GMail web interface select some text including the sender reciever information dragging it See screencast Actual results Apparently it shows a part of the screen best you look at the screencast Expected results It should have shown the text

Summary: Consider hand rolling radios and checkboxes for resizability
Description: In bug 394892 Markus Stange fixed radios and checkboxes to use native Cocoa widgets and made them resizable which puts Firefox a step up from where Chrome and Safari currently are It s a shame though that they look pixellated at large sizes  see attached image In the intervening time an  2x set of image states for checkboxes and radios has been introduced  try setting transform scale 2 against an input in Chrome or Safari which would be a stop gap but it would be very nice if this could be resolution independent Other browsers  for example Chrome on Windows have their own set of vector widgets including checkboxes and radios Is this something Mozilla would be interested in doing It would obviously be better if OS X introduced resolution independent controls and I d imagine it can t be far off so that might be the better path

Summary: Provide option for about privatebrowsing to show blank page like about newtab
Description: Since the new about privatebrowsing page is intentionally eye catching  Bug 1199613 it would be nice to give users the option to show a blank page like they can with about newtab  via the cog menu in the upper right hand corner This could be used to avoid attracting unwanted attention and would make the new tab page more consistent across the different browsing modes  it could also potentially be used to show the user s top sites which would be both useful and give suggested sites more exposure Private browsing mode is still clearly indicated with the mask icon and titlebar name so it is not essential for it to be communicated through the new tab page

Summary: currentTime inaccurate in video element
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Windows NT 6 3 WOW64 rv 40 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 40 0 Build ID 20150826023504 Steps to reproduce Using the developer tools I advanced the currentTime to the last time code that shows the frame on the video element In the developer tools console document getElementById myVideoElement timeCode  8 699999 In my example video the last time code showing the desired frame was 8 699999 I then use the time code in ffmpeg to extract an image Actual results The image is from the next frame of the video rather than the frame that is currently displayed in the video element Expected results The frame extracted by ffmpeg should have matched the frame displayed in the video element I have testing this in the nightly build as well The frame changes in a different place in the nightly build Frame changes at 8 699999 in the current stable release  40 0 3 and at 8 633333 in the nightly and at 8 604 in ffmpeg I have verified that adobe premier seems to agree with ffmpeg and have observed that other browsers likewise have some variation as to what time code actually changes the frame

Summary: using the external array SSL_ImplementedCiphers directly should be deprecated
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  X11 Fedora Linux x86_64 rv 40 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 40 0 Build ID 20150827075926 Steps to reproduce I have updated the documentation at https developer mozilla org en US docs Mozilla Projects NSS SSL_functions sslfnc html  and fixed curl to access the array through the accessors https github com bagder curl commit 7380433d Actual results Despite accessor functions were introduced in 2010  see bug  496993 software using NSS continues to accessing the external array SSL_ImplementedCiphers directly This causes dynamic linking issues at run time after an update of NSS https lists fedoraproject org pipermail devel 2015 September 214117 html Expected results It should have been clarified in the ssl h header file that using the array SSL_ImplementedCiphers directly is deprecated and it is recommended to access the array through the accessor functions

Summary: Kerberos stops working on v40  nsHttpNegotiateAuth ChallengeReceived URI blocked
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  X11 Ubuntu Linux x86_64 rv 40 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 40 0 Build ID 20150826185918 Steps to reproduce I ve just upgraded to Firefox 40 0 3 and Kerberos negotiation has stopped working The only negiotiate config setting changed from default is  network negotiate auth delegation uris which is set to our local domain name kinit has been run and shows a valid ticket for that domain On earlier firefox versions when going to one of our internal sites that supports kerberos it would be negotiated Now with v40 no negotiation is done Following the troubleshooting detailed in https access redhat com documentation en US Red_Hat_Enterprise_Linux 5 html Deployment_Guide sso config firefox html I ve run firefox with  export NSPR_LOG_MODULES negotiateauth 5 and  export NSPR_LOG_FILE tmp moz log that juts reports  1679968384 7f2f9a838580 nsHttpNegotiateAuth ChallengeReceived URI blocked I ve tried setting  network negotiate auth trusted uris to match the domain of the host but that didn t help and previously the default  empty worked fine Actual results In v39 and before when going to a site that offered kerberos when a valid ticket existed kerberos negotiation would be performed Since upgrading to v40 no negotiation is done and with logging turned on it is logged as nsHttpNegotiateAuth ChallengeReceived URI blocked Expected results Kerberos negotiation in v40 should match that in previous versions and be performed

Summary: Open websocket throws NS_ERROR_NOT_CONNECTED in  send call
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Macintosh Intel Mac OS X 10 10 rv 41 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 41 0 Build ID 20150617030205 Steps to reproduce Call  send on an open websocket  reproducible as part of a larger test but not seeing this elsewhere if  webSocket readyState  webSocket OPEN try  webSocket send msg catch err debugger This gets hit console error err throw err Actual results Threw exception NS_ERROR_NOT_CONNECTED Expected results Exception should not have been thrown since the websocket is in the open state I m unclear on whether this should be possible It seems to be the same issue seen by the reporter of https bugzilla mozilla org show_bug cgi id 977020 but that bug was resolved claiming https bugzilla mozilla org show_bug cgi id 960508 was the only real issue that apparently a change was needed to the thrown error object What I d like to know is whether this is really intended behaviour and what would cause this exception to be thrown on a websocket which claims to be open I m seeing this on 40 0 3 but not my nightly instance which is 41 0a1  2015 06 17

Summary: TLS server accepts application data between CCS and Finished message
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  X11 Fedora Linux x86_64 rv 40 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 40 0 Build ID 20150827075926 Steps to reproduce nss 3 20 0 1 0 fc22 x86_64 Negotiate regular TLS session after that client initiates renegotiation and during the renegotiation it sends Application Data records Start the server with openssl req  x509  newkey rsa  keyout localhost key  out localhost crt  nodes  batch openssl pkcs12  export  out cert p12  passout pass inkey localhost key  name localhost  keypbe DES EDE3 CBC  macalg SHA1  in localhost crt mkdir nssdb certutil  N  d sql nssdb empty password pk12util  i cert p12  d sql nssdb  W  selfserv  n localhost  d sql nssdb p 4433  V ssl3 start reproducer with pip install  pre tlslite ng git clone https github com tomato42 tlsfuzzer git cd tlsfuzzer PYTHONPATH python scripts test openssl 3712 py Actual results When Application Data is sent between Change Cipher Spec and Finished message the connection is not aborted by server Expected results While application data can be interleaved between handshake messages the CCS Finished pair is special in that it s the only place in which the handshake protocol and application data _can t_ be interleaved Or in other words the following sections from RFC 5246 apply Application data MUST NOT be sent prior to the completion of the first handshake  before a cipher suite other than TLS_NULL_WITH_NULL_NULL is established and A Finished message is always sent immediately after a change cipher spec message to verify that the key exchange and authentication processes were successful and It is a fatal error if a Finished message is not preceded by a ChangeCipherSpec message at the appropriate point in the handshake isn t overruled by Recipients MUST receive and process interleaved application layer traffic during handshakes subsequent to the first one on a connection See also https rt openssl org Ticket Display html id 3712 user guest pass guest for the discussion about it

Summary: PKCS11 renegotiation
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  X11 Fedora Linux x86_64 rv 41 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 41 0 Build ID 20150922120153 Steps to reproduce I created a csr and signed the certificate with self signed CA I imported the certificate and key on my smartcard  epass2003 I loaded the pkcs11 module into firefox Actual results When I connect to my website firefox asks for my pin and propose me my certificate After a while  5min that seems to be the renegotiation I get SSL_ERROR_SIGN_HASHES_FAILURE and firefox doesn t ask for certificate selection or whatever I need to close firefox and reopen it to be asked again pin and certificate picking Expected results Firefox should use the certificate I choose when first connection to the website as it does when the certificate is stored on local keystore

Summary: Implement resize media event for HTML5 video
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Macintosh Intel Mac OS X 10_10_5 AppleWebKit 537 36  KHTML like Gecko Chrome 45 0 2454 101 Safari 537 36 Steps to reproduce HTML5 spec defines a  resize media event to fire when the input video s size changes https html spec whatwg org multipage embedded content html event media resize This seems to be missing from Firefox https developer mozilla org en US docs Web Guide Events Media_events Actual results When the video source is from a mobile device the aspect ratio can change depending on how the user holds the device in portrait or landscape mode The video size can also change when using more tracks in one video Firefox doesn t fire this event and it s also missing from the developer guide Tested on desktop Firefox and an Android mobile Expected results Firefox should fire the resize event according to the HTML spec just like Chrome and Opera already do

Summary: Malformed Client Key Exchange messages are accepted  Handshake length
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  X11 Fedora Linux x86_64 rv 41 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 41 0 Build ID 20150922120153 Steps to reproduce Client sends a Client Key Exchange message during RSA key exchange in which the Handshake length field doesn t match the EncryptedPreMasterSecret length field Automated reproducer mkdir nssdb certutil  N  d sql nssdb empty password openssl req  x509  newkey rsa  keyout localhost key  out localhost crt  nodes  batch openssl pkcs12  export  out cert p12  passout pass inkey localhost key  name localhost  keypbe DES EDE3 CBC  macalg SHA1  in localhost crt pk12util  i cert p12  d sql nssdb W  selfserv  n localhost  d sql nssdb p 4433  V ssl3 in different console pip install  pre tlslite ng git clone https github com tomato42 tlsfuzzer git cd tlsfuzzer PYTHONPATH python scripts test truncating of kRSA client key exchange py Actual results The server didn t send an Alert message Expected results Server should have sent a decode_error message RFC 5246 A server MUST accept ClientHello messages both with and without the extensions field and  as for all other messages it MUST check that the amount of data in the message precisely matches one of these formats if not then it MUST send a fatal  decode_error alert

Summary: HTTP 401 errors will trigger login prompts when inlined on third party websites
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Windows NT 6 3 WOW64 AppleWebKit 537 36  KHTML like Gecko Chrome 44 0 2371 0 Safari 537 36 Steps to reproduce Using the  img  tag to inline content from a website  even 3rd party remote websites that are behind an HTTP Authentication screen will trigger a prompt asking for login credentials For instance link this image on a forum http filthyfigments com members comics onelatenight 0109 jpg Actual results You will get this prompt http i imgur com WOgt5Ec png This scares the hell out of people Expected results I expected a broken image When someone tried to link this image  which apparently belongs to a paid user area of a porn site dozens of people browsing the index page of my website who use Mozilla Firefox got a prompt asking them for their porn site credentials which made them believe their browser or my website was compromised by a virus Nobody who was introduced to computers in the last decade has used an HTTP Authentication form Nobody knows what they look like This should be hidden unless you are accessing the document directly

Summary: Firefox and Flash do not play nicely together when addressing IDN TLDs in Punycode
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Macintosh Intel Mac OS X 10_11 AppleWebKit 601 1 56  KHTML like Gecko Version 9 0 Safari 601 1 56 Steps to reproduce Earlier this year APNIC Labs ran an experiment to determine if there were any underlying issues preventing the resolution of new Top Level Domains The experiment process and results are available http www potaroo net reports Universal Acceptance UA Report pdf Actual results The experiment found an anomaly when IE and Firefox browsers accessed punycode IDN TLDs using Flash When the same experiment was run using HTML5 there were no such anomalies Microsoft have been contacted I m using this form to contact Mozilla I m also contacting Adobe for the Flash issue Expected results There should have been no anomaly

Summary: client hello with malformed session id is accepted
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  X11 Fedora Linux x86_64 rv 41 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 41 0 Build ID 20150930122139 Steps to reproduce Send Client Hello to server with session_id 33 bytes long Automated reproducer mkdir nssdb certutil  N  d sql nssdb empty password openssl req  x509  newkey rsa  keyout localhost key  out localhost crt  nodes  batch openssl pkcs12  export  out cert p12  passout pass inkey localhost key  name localhost  keypbe DES EDE3 CBC  macalg SHA1  in localhost crt pk12util  i cert p12  d sql nssdb W  selfserv  n localhost  d sql nssdb p 4433  V ssl3 in different console pip install  pre tlslite ng git clone https github com tomato42 tlsfuzzer git cd tlsfuzzer PYTHONPATH python scripts test invalid session id py Actual results server responds with Server Hello Expected results Server should abort connection In SSLv3 and all versions of TLS  e g RFC 5246 the SessionID is defined as opaque SessionID 0 32 that means that any SessionID longer than 32 bytes is an incorrectly formatted Client Hello message and as such should be rejected

Summary: Updating HTTP headers with a 304
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Macintosh Intel Mac OS X 10_10_5 AppleWebKit 601 1 56  KHTML like Gecko Version 9 0 Safari 601 1 56 Steps to reproduce http lxr mozilla org mozilla central source netwerk protocol http nsHttpResponseHead cpp 573 lists a number of headers that are ignored with a 304 response updates a cache  if I m reading the code correctly It includes ETag Content Location and Content MD5 with the result that these headers cannot be updated by a 304 response There are legitimate cases for doing so An ETag might be upgraded from weak to strong by a server  A Content Location might be updated  A Content MD5 might be corrected Unless there s a good reason  e g security why these shouldn t be updated by a 304 from the server please remove them from that list While we re at it it d be good to know why  Assume Cache Control no transform implies that Content Encoding Content Range and Content Type can t be updated by a 304 Is this just an implementation difficulty

Summary: firefox stops scrolling using the synaptics touchpad after opening a pdf file in adobe reader
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Windows NT 6 1 WOW64 rv 41 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 41 0 Build ID 20151014143721 Steps to reproduce I was browsing the web with firefox  V31 Scrolling with the synaptics touchpad worked fine but after opening a pdf file firefox became jerky when scrolling with the touchpad Note FireFox Scrolling was jerky So I decided to update as much as I could the relevant software Namely FireFox and the Synaptics drivers Being the two that seemed to be the problem So 1 Installed latest Dell Alienware Synaptics Touchpad Driver 7 4 2 Updated FireFox to 41 0 2 All went well and FireFox was scrolling smoothly using circular scrolling I opened a PDF file in Adobe Reader XI Firefox no longer scrolled using the touchpad scroll boundaries including circular scrolling ALL OTHER programs such as word excell access powerpoint visio openoffice libreoffice IE I have not found another program that does not scroll after opening a pdf other than FireFox it is the only one affected After several methods including re installing touchpad drivers shutting down and restarting the laptop the current workaround I use is this If I do open a pdf file and then when firefox stops scrolling properly  which it does then I open the Synaptics touchpad properties and unselect the circular scrolling then apply and then re select the circular scrolling and apply and ok then firefox scrolls properly until i open another pdf file Like I say firefox is the ONLY program that is affected ALL other programs STILL scroll as expected with the synaptics touchpad and circular scrolling enabled I do not have to uncheck and re check the circular scrolling to use any other program This is only for firefox thank you Alienware M17XR4 Windows 7 Professional 64 bit SP1 32GB Ram Actual results I was browsing the web with firefox Scrolling with the synaptics touchpad worked fine but after opening a pdf file firefox became jerky when scrolling with the touchpad i updated the touchpad drivers and firefox and it worked fine untill i opened a pdf file and then firefos stopped responding to the touchpad ALL OTHER programs work fine as expected after opening a pdf file ONLY firefox is affected Expected results I should have been browsing the web with firefox using the snyaptics touchpad without firefox being jerky when scrolling I should have been able to open a pdf file without it affecting the behaviour of firefox I should be able to browse the web with firefox and the synaptics touchpad circular scrolling option enabled and be able to open a pdf file without it affecting firefox s scrolling functionality thank you

Summary: HttpOnly flag is not set for multiple cookies resolving to same domain with same name path
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Windows NT 6 1 WOW64 rv 38 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 38 0 Build ID 20150806103657 Steps to reproduce Server application returns the following cookies  Set Cookie headers in the order shown when accessing https www mydomain com JSESSIONID ABC50B514D0E4F95A0B03CD7A8F4E74 pnedc710 path domain www mydomain com Secure HttpOnly JSESSIONID ABC50B514D0E4F95A0B03CD7A8F4E74 pnedc710 path domain www mydomain com Secure HttpOnly JSESSIONID ABC50B514D0E4F95A0B03CD7A8F4E74 pnedc710 Path Secure Actual results Firefox stores two cookies as shown in Firebug 2 0 12 in Cookies tab JSESSIONID ABC50B514D0E4F95A0B03CD7A8F4E74 pnedc710 path domain www mydomain com Secure HttpOnly JSESSIONID ABC50B514D0E4F95A0B03CD7A8F4E74 pnedc710 Path Secure Expected results The Cookie with no domain spec and not HttpOnly  Path Secure should resolve to the same domain as the cookie for domain www mydomain com  path domain www mydomain com Secure HttpOnly and the name and path specs are equal Firefox should prefer the more secure restricted Cookie  HttpOnly  Secure rather than the less secure Cookie Chrome 46 0 2490 71 exhibits identical incorrect behavior IE 11 0 9600 18015 exhibits the desired behavior i e the more secure HttpOnly cookie is the one stored

Summary: Auth required popup is shown for unknown digest algorithms  SHA 256
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Macintosh Intel Mac OS X 10_11_1 AppleWebKit 601 2 7  KHTML like Gecko Version 9 0 1 Safari 601 2 7 Steps to reproduce If a webserver returns a header like this WWW Authenticate Digest realm MyRealm qop auth algorithm SHA 256 nonce MyNonce charSet UTF 8 Then Firefox will show the normal  Authentication Required popup dialog where username and password credentials can be entered Actual results If you fill in the credentials and press enter in that popup there is no more request to the server and the 401 UNAUTHORIZED error is shown Expected results Firefox should determine the Digest algorithm from the reponse headers before showing the popup If the algorithm is unknown to Fx don t bother showing the credentials popup

Summary: High memory usage when buffering multiple videos
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Windows NT 6 1 WOW64 rv 38 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 38 0 Build ID 20150916094008 Steps to reproduce Go to https www manyvids com Vids Warning NSFW Open any 5 videos with middle click Close these tabs as soon as they are fully loaded  indicated by their icons Repeat the process for another 5 videos Repeat the process for a couple more iterations opening more than 5 videos at once speeds things up Actual results Memory usage growing very fast Most of that memory gets freed if FF is given time to digest it but apparently not all of it The problem accumulates the more you repeat the process Typical results of FF memory leaks occur slowness hanging eventually rendering black screen and crashing Notes Under normal usage with normal web sites accumulation of leaks plays a bigger role because FF would run for hours Too bad it turned out this site doesn t make leaks as obvious as I initially though Expected results Memory shouldn t get consumed so fast Memory should get freed completely

Summary: Audio is  pseudo randomly muted
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Windows NT 6 1 WOW64 rv 42 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 42 0 Build ID 20151029151421 Steps to reproduce Tough to reproduce but here is what we ve seen 1 Single tab open  Sound is working 2 User begins using the page  An internal webapp that plays sound to notify the user of successes or failures 3 Suddenly the sound will be muted The new audio icon is visible and shows that it is muted  it can be unmuted although it doesn t remain un muted Actual results Sound is muted and we can t find out what is causing this perhaps a hotkey Expected results Audio never should have been muted the user never hit the mute icon We ve even tried changing user_pref browser tabs showAudioPlayingIcon false This setting works but it will still become muted and then the user can t un mute the sound

Summary: Unable to set persistent cookies if cookies where set at future date
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Windows NT 6 3 WOW64 rv 42 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 42 0 Build ID 20151029151421 Steps to reproduce I observed this behavior on a local machine running microsoft IIS express webserver Do the following steps Change local date to future and set a persistent cookie  e g 2015 12 31 Change back to current date the cookie is still there  Remove the cookie  Set two persistent cookies one which expires before the date you set before  e g 2015 12 30 the second after that date Actual results After setting a persistent cookie in future I m not longer able to set a persistent cookie which expires before the future date  even if I change the local time back to a normal value To stick to the above example You set a cookie on 2015 12 31 The cookie which expires before the future date is gone  e g 2015 12 30 The cookie which expires after that date is successfully set  e g 2016 01 01 IE and Safari acting correctly but Firefox Chrome and even Opera are acting wrong Expected results Firefox should accept cookies even if a cookie with a future date was saved before

Summary: cache completely invalidated when Stop Loading This Page clicked
Description: I m working remote in the Australian bush on an dodgy connection this week I noticed that when I was loading bugzilla it took 47s to load most assets but the request to gravatar was still pending I click the X in the url bar  Stop Loading This Page When I clicked the refresh button  Reload the current page in the url bar the page reloaded but took 40s to load again I had the network monitor dev tool open both times I noticed that I was getting http 200 responses from the bugzilla on BOTH requests I m surprised that on the second try I did not get 304 Not Modified After waiting for gravatar to load and the  Stop Loading This Page switched to  Reload the current page meaning the page had completely loaded I hit refresh and I got the expected 304s This leads me to believe that if the user clicks to cancel loading a page we don t cache assets that we have received fully Can we

Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Macintosh Intel Mac OS X 10 9 rv 43 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 43 0 Build ID 20151119130424 Steps to reproduce Call ctx drawImage with an image referencing an svg document as dataURL itself containing an SVGImage referencing an animated image converted to dataURL fiddle  http jsfiddle net o7x4qj5w Note  also works with gif  http jsfiddle net bh0cy4r5 Every version supporting svg and canvas seem to be concerned Every major browser seem to be concerned Related bug  https bugzilla mozilla org show_bug cgi id 666855 Actual results The animation contained in the SVGImage is animated when painted by ctx drawImage Expected results According to  a href https html spec whatwg org multipage scripting html image sources for 2d rendering contexts canvasimagesource 3 the specs a only the default image or the first frame of the animation should be painted

Summary: Cannot horizontally enlarge HTML canvas in XUL overlay
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Windows NT 6 1 WOW64 rv 42 0 Gecko 20100101 Firefox 42 0 Build ID 20151029151421 Steps to reproduce I m trying to add HiDPI support to https addons mozilla org cs thunderbird addon timeline  This TB addon uses a HTML canvas element in XUL overlay like this stack id timelineStack context timelineContext html canvas id mycanvas height 20 stack with the appropriate HTML namespace mapping In the code I try the common trick of enlarging  canvas while downsizing it via CSS this canvas  document getElementById mycanvas this canvas width  this width  this pixelRatio this canvas height  this height  this pixelRatio this canvas style width  this width  px this canvas style height  this height  px Actual results However I noticed I cannot practically enlarge the width of the canvas image data Changing the height can be done in both directions but with width I can only make it smaller If I make width larger  i e pixelRatio  1 the canvas correctly reports the desired size in canvas width but when I draw on it it still uses the horizontal resolution it had before scaling By applying ctx setTransform 1 this pixelRatio 0 0 1 0 0 the drawing commands start to work as expected However this is odd because I always do symmetric scaling of both width and height Also the downscaled image looks ugly even though it should be displayed using the preferred HiDPI enabling technique  I enlarge lineWidth and fontSize appropriately too There are no canvas related errors in the Error console

Summary: WebSocket upgrade request doesn t support authorization header for basic auth
Description: User Agent Mozilla 5 0  Macintosh Intel Mac OS X 10_11_1 AppleWebKit 537 36  KHTML like Gecko Chrome 46 0 2490 86 Safari 537 36 Steps to reproduce run a local service  eg http localhost 5100 I m running a nodejs express service locally Open console and create a websocket using basic auth  ws  new WebSocket ws username password localhost 5100 Actual results The WebSocket is successfully created but the upgrade request does not include the  authorization header If I want to authenticate WebSocket connections I need to do it through the open channel instead of through the upgrade request itself Expected results The upgrade request should include an  authorization header including the base64 encoded string  username password as per http www w3 org Protocols HTTP 1 0 spec html Authorization
